member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone
member.summary: The Milestone represents a single event in the lifetime of a Loan.
member.remarks: See the remarks for the Milestones class for a complete list of the predefined milestones and their sequence in the loan's lifetime.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.IMilestone
member.summary: Interface for Milestone class.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.OccursBefore(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Determines if the current milestone occurs before the one specified
member.param: The milestone to compare against the current milestone. A null value will always result in this function returning false.
member.returns: Returns true if the current milestone occurs earlier in the loan lifetime sequence than the specified milestone, false otherwise.
member.remarks: In languages that support operator overloading, this is equivalent to the less-than (<) operator.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.OccursOnOrBefore(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Determines if the current milestone occurs before the one specified or is the same as the specified one.
member.param: The milestone to compare against the current milestone. A null value will always result in this function returning false.
member.returns: Returns true if the current milestone occurs earlier in the loan lifetime sequence than or is the same as the specified milestone, false otherwise.
member.remarks: In languages that support operator overloading, this is equivalent to the less-than-or-equals (<=) operator.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.OccursAfter(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Determines if the current milestone occurs after the one specified
member.param: The milestone to compare against the current milestone. A null value will always result in this function returning false.
member.returns: Returns true if the current milestone occurs later in the loan lifetime sequence than the specified milestone, false otherwise.
member.remarks: In languages that support operator overloading, this is equivalent to the greater-than (>) operator.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.OccursOnOrAfter(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Determines if the current milestone occurs after the one specified or is the same as the one specified.
member.param: The milestone to compare against the current milestone. A null value will always result in this function returning false.
member.returns: Returns true if the current milestone occurs later in the loan lifetime sequence than or is the same as the specified milestone, false otherwise.
member.remarks: In languages that support operator overloading, this is equivalent to the greater-than-or-equals (>=) operator.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.op_GreaterThan(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Compares two milestones to determine if one is after the other in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.param: The first Milestone to compare.
The second Milestone to compare.
member.returns: Returns true if m1 occurs after m2 in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.remarks: This operator will return false if either operand is null.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Compares two milestones to determine if they are equal or if one occurs after the other in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.param: The first Milestone to compare.
The second Milestone to compare.
member.returns: Returns true if m1 and m2 are the same milestone or if m1 occurs after m2 in the loan lifetime sequence.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.op_LessThan(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Compares two milestones to determine if one occurs prior the other in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.param: The first Milestone to compare.
The second Milestone to compare.
member.returns: Returns true if m1 occurs before m2 in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.remarks: This operator will return true if either operand is null.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone.op_LessThanOrEqual(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestone)
member.summary: Compares two milestones to determine if they are equal or if one occurs before the other in the loan lifetime sequence.
member.param: The first Milestone to compare.
The second Milestone to compare.
member.returns: Returns true if m1 and m2 are the same milestone or if m1 occurs before m2 in the loan lifetime sequence.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessEnums.Milestones
member.summary: The Milestones class represents the set of all events (milestones) that can occur during the lifetime of a loan.
member.remarks:
During the lifetime of a loan, the following milestones are achieved by loans in this order by default:
Started
Processing
Submittal
Approval
Docs Signing
Funding
Completion
The values above are the milestones that exist by default and are common to every loan unless renamed or reordered. Additionally, every Encompass system can define its own set of custom milestones, additional stages in the lifetime sequence that are unique to the company's business process.
The milestones defined for any given loan are determined when the loan is first created. At that point, whatever milestones are defined in the source Encompass system determined the lifetime sequence for that loan unless a MilestoneTemplate is applied to the loan. Thus, it is possible to have loans with different milestone sequences
The values above represent the names of the default milestones and can be used with the GetItemByName() function to retrieve a particular milestone. Alternatively, you may use the First property to obtain a reference to the first milestone (Started) and then use the Next and Previous properties to traverse the non-archived milestone sequence in order. However, keep in mind that the set of milestones currently defined in the system may be different than those which are defined for any particular loan.
When iterating over the entire Milestons collection the archived Milestones will be included and the end of the list.

member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time at which the appointment ends.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the appointment's bar in the calendar view.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the event is an all-day event.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Appointment.ReminderEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if a reminder should be shown for this event.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Appointment.ReminderInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes prior to the appointment for the reminder to be displayed.
member.remarks:
This property will return -1 if the property is false.
This property can only take on values that represent a whole number minutes (if < 60), hours (if >= 60 and < 1440), or days (if >= 1440). Attempts to set this value to something which does not fit this criteria will result in the value being rounded down to the nearest hour or day.
For example, setting this property to the value 330 (5 hours and 30 minutes) would result in the interval being rounded down to 300 (5 hours).

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Appointment.ReminderActive
member.summary: Indicates if the appointment's reminder is currently in effect.
member.remarks: This property returns true if the appointment's reminder is enabled and the current time is within the of the appointment's .

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Calendar.CreateAppointmentForUser(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates a new appointment for the specified user.
member.param: The user for whom the appointment is to be scheduled.
The starting date and time for the appointment.
The ending date and time for the appointment.
member.remarks:
The returned Appointment object is unsaved and will not be persisted to the Encompass Server until the method is invoked.
This method can only be invoked by users with the Administrator persona.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Calendar.GetAllAppointments
member.summary: Retrieves all of the appointments for the current user.
member.returns: An containing all appointments, past and present, for the current user.
member.remarks: The returned list will be sorted based on the appointments' start times. However, all-day events may be sequenced anywhere within the set of events which occur on the same day. If the user has a large number of appointments, this call may require significant time to complete.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Calendar.GetAllAppointmentsForUser(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all the appointments for a specified user.
member.param: The user for whom the appointments are to be retrieved.
member.returns: An containing all appointments, past and present, for the specified user.
member.remarks:
The returned list will be sorted based on the appointments' start times. However, all-day events may be sequenced anywhere within the set of events which occur on the same day.
This method can only be invoked by users with the Administrator persona. If the user has a large number of appointments, this call may require significant time to complete.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Calendar.Calendar.GetAppointmentsInRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Retrieves all appointments that occur within a specified time range.
member.param: The start of the date/time range.
The end of the date/time range.
member.returns: An that contains all appointments from the Calendar which begin and/or end in the specified time range. Appointments which begin exctly at the time specified by the rangeEnd parameter are not included in the result set. In other words, the date range used is denoted as [rangeBegin, rangeEnd).

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.Disclosure2015
member.summary: Represents a single Disclosure Tracking 2015 record associated with a Loan.
member.remarks:
The inherited Date property of a Disclosure represents the date on which the disclosure was made.
Disclosure instances become invalid when the Refresh method is invoked on the parent Loan object. Attempting to access this object after invoking Refresh() will result in an exception.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LogEntry
member.summary: A LogEntry represents a single item in a loan's . This class is an abstract base class for all possible entries that can be stored in the log.
member.remarks: LogEntry instances become invalid when the Loan's Refresh method is invoked. Attempting to access this object after invoking refresh will result in an exception.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.ILogEntry
member.summary: Interface for LogEntry class.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LogEntry.ID
member.summary: Gets the unique indentifier for this log entry.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LogEntry.Date
member.summary: Gets the relevant date of the LogEntry. This date is used to sequence the entry in the loan's .
member.remarks:
This date may represent different values dependeing on the derived class implementation. For example, the entry type uses this property to represent that date on which the conversation occurred. The class uses this field to indicate either the date on which the associated document is due to be received or the actual date it was received.
Depending on the derived class's implementation, this date may be null if, for example, the log entry represents an event which has not yet been sequenced into the loan's lifetime. For example, if a loan has not yet been sent to processing, the for the Completion milestone will have a null Date. Once the loan is sent for processing, this date will be set according to the rules defined for the current Encompass Server.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.Disclosure2015.ReceivedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the disclosure was received by the borrower.
member.remarks: If the disclosure has not been received, this property will be null; otherwise, it will be a DateTime value. To mark a disclosure as not having been received, set this property to null. When the for the disclosure is set to Mail, Fax, or InPerson, the ReceivedDate will be set automatically based on compliance regulations. For Mail deliveries, the ReceivedDate is always three postal days from the date sent. For Fax and InPerson, the date received will match the disclosure date. Attempting to set this property when the DeliveryMethod is any of those values will result in an exception.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a TemplateEntry from the specified path.
member.param: The user-qualified path of the template entry.
member.returns: The TemplateEntry for this object.

remarks.p: The userQualifiedPath provided must represent an absolute path and start with either the public:\ or personal:\ domain prefix. If the path is for a personal template, then the path must be a "user-qualified" path and have the format personal:\<userid>\.... The user-qualified path includes the User ID of the template's owner in order to fully determine the source of the template.
If the path ends with a "\" it will be interpreted to represent a folder, otherwise it will represent a template entry.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Parse(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a TemplateEntry from the specified path.
member.param: The absolute path of the template entry.
The User ID of the template owner, if the template is in the personal domain.
member.returns: The TemplateEntry for this object.
member.remarks: The path provided must represent an absolute path and start with either the public:\ or personal:\ domain prefix. For personal templates, the path is assumed not to be a "user-qualified" path and, instead, the owner of the template will be determined by the ownerId parameter.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Combine(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry,System.String)
member.summary: Combines a TenplateEntry and a string representing a subpath into a new TemplateEntry.
member.param: The TemplateEntry which represents the parent folder.
The relative path of the template or folder.
member.returns: Returns a TemplateEntry representing the combined path.
member.remarks: The folderEntry must be non-null and have a of Folder. The relativePath must be a string which does not start with the folder seperator character (\).

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.GetPersonalRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a TemplateEntry that represents the root of the personal domain owned by the specified user.
member.param: The User ID of the owner.
member.returns: Returns a TemplateEntry representing the root of the owner's private domain.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.DomainPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the TemplateEntry within either the public or personal domain.

remarks.p: This property will return the portion of the path which excludes the public:\ or personal:\ domain indicator, e.g. \Companywide\ARM Loans\My ARM Template. A path for a folder will always end with "\" while a path for a template will not.
The retrieve the full path, including the public/personal prefix, use the property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Path
member.summary: Gets the full path of the TemplateEntry.

remarks.p: The path will start with either public:\ or personal:\ to denote whether the file is in the public or personal storage area. A path for a folder will always end with "\" while a path for a template will not.
The retrieve the portion of the path without the public/personal prefix, use the property. The retrieve a "user-qualified" path for the template, use the property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.UserQualifiedPath
member.summary: Gets the user-qualified path of the TemplateEntry, which includes the owner's identity for private templates.

remarks.p: The path will start with either public:\ or personal:\ to denote whether the file is in the public or personal storage area. A path for a folder will always end with "\" while a path for a template will not.

Unlike the property, this property will include the template owner's User ID as part of the path when the TemplateEntry represents a file within a user's personal domain. A user-qualified path for a personal template has the format personal:\<userid>\.... This path can be used to differentiate between templates with the same but belonging to two separate users.
The retrieve the portion of the path without the public/personal prefix, use the property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Name
member.summary: Returns the name portion of the file or folder.
member.remarks: This property returns only the last portion of the path, which is the name of the template/folder which is represented by this object.

member.summary: Gets the type of TemplateEntry represented by the object.

member.summary: Gets the last modification date of the entry.

member.summary: Gets the TemplateEntry for the folder which contains the current object.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner of the current TemplateEntry.
member.remarks: If the TemplateEntry resides in the public domain, this property will return null. Otherwise, this property will return the User ID of the object's owner.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry.Properties
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom properties attached to the TemplateEntry.
member.remarks: Most TemplateEntry objects which represent an actual Template will have one or more properties that allows for convenient display of summary info for the template, e.g. a Description. The proeprties are name/value pairs and can be different for each template type. Thus, you should use the method to determine the properties available for the specific TemplateEntry.

member.summary: No day type specified

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendarDayType.BusinessDay
member.summary: The day represents a day the business is open

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendarDayType.Weekend
member.summary: The day represents a recurring weekend non-work day

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendarDayType.Holiday
member.summary: No day represents a non-recurring non-work day

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.DaysOfWeek
member.summary: Rerpesents one or more days of the week.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar
member.summary: Represents a calendar with defined business and non-business days.
member.remarks: The dates in the Encompass calendars range from Jan 1, 2000 to Dec 31, 2029. Any date outside that range will cause an exception to be raised from the calendar.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.IBusinessCalendar
member.summary: Represents the interface for the DataObject object.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar.IsWeekendDay(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Indicates if a specific date falls on a weekend (as defined by the calendar).
member.param: The date to test.
member.returns: Return true if the date falls on a day marked as a weekend day, false otherwise.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar.IsBusinessDay(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Indicates if a specific date is a business day.
member.param: The date to test.
member.returns: Return true if the date is a business day, false otherwise.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar.GetDayType(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the type of day for a specific date.
member.param: The date to test.
member.returns: Returns the of the specified date based on the definition of the calendar.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar.AddBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a specified number of business days to the specified date.
member.param: The starting date of the operation.
The number of business days to add.
A flag to indicate if the date should be advanced to the next closest business day prior to adding the number of days specified by the count.
member.returns: Returns the date of the business day as computed from the calendar.
member.remarks: If the date parameter is a non-business day and startFromClosestBusinessDay is true, the computation will first advanced to the next closest business day and then add count additional business days. If the startFromClosestBusinessDay parameter is false, then the next closest business day will count as the first day in the computation. If the date parameter is a business day, then the startFromClosestBusinessDay value will have no effect on the computation.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Configuration.BusinessCalendar.GetNextClosestBusinessDay(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the next closest business day to the specified date.
member.param: The date from which to start.
member.returns: The first business day on or after the specified date.
member.remarks: If the date specified by the date parameter is a business day, then that date will be returned. Otherwise, the calendar will advance from the specified date until a business day is found and return that date.

member.summary: Gets the type of calendar represented by the current object.

member.summary: Gets the workdays (i.e. non-weekend days) for the calendar

member.param: The prior expiration date of the rate lock.
The number of days to extend the lock request.
member.returns: Returns the price adjustment for a lock extension of the specified number of days starting on the date specified as the prior expiration date. If the pricing is user-controlled, this method will return 0. If the number of days specified is not permitted by company policy, an exception will occur.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactCursor
member.summary: Provides a server-side cursor for iterating over a large set of objects.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Cursors.Cursor
member.summary: Provides an interface for collections of objects stored on the Encompass Server to allow for quick random access without having to pull all of the data to the client.
member.remarks:
A Cursor represents a list of objects which is held on the Encompass Server and which the client can then access by directly fetching individual items or even subsets. This provides a great deal of optimization to operations that would otherwise require large amounts of data to be transferred to the client.
Every method invocation on a cursor requires a round trip to the Encompass Server, so you should make every attempt to retrieve the data in as efficient a manner as possible. For example, you should use the GetItems() method to retrieve a set of contiguous elements from the cursor instead of invoking the GetItem() method multiple times, which would be far more expensive.
Because a cursor consumes resources on the server, you should invoke the Cursor's method when you are done using it. This will release the server resources immediately. Failure to invoke Close() (or, equivalently, Dispose()) will cause a resource leak on the server until the is closed, at which point any open cursors for the session are released.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Cursors.Cursor.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the item from the cursor at the specified index.
member.param: Index of the item to be retrieved (with 0 as the first index).
member.returns: Returns the specified object.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Cursors.Cursor.GetItems(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a subset of the cursor items starting at a specified index.
member.param: The index at which to start the subset.
The number of items to retrieve
member.returns: Returns an list containing the elements specified.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Cursors.Cursor.Close
member.summary: Closes the cursor, releasing any resources allocated by it on the Encompass Server.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Cursors.Cursor.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Provides a fast, efficient enumerator for the cursor.

returns.p: The enumerator returned by this method is optimized for iterating over the contents of a Cursor. It pulls the cursor data down in chunks instead of fetching the items individually in order to minimize round trips to the server while also preventing large chunks of data from having to be passed back and forth in any one single transaction.

From the application perspective, the enumerator will return objects of the underlying type of the Cursor. For example, interating over a
will return a sequence of object.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactCustomField.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the custom field.
member.remarks:
When setting this property, the value will be automatically reformatted or converted, if possible, based on the of the field. For example, if the property has type and you set the Value to "123456789", it will automatically be reformatted as "12345-6789".
If you attempt to set this property to a value which is cannot be converted to a value which is appropriate for the field's , an exception will be raised. For example, attempting to set the Value to "X" for a field whose type is will cause an exception to be raised. Similarly, if the field's is , then attempting to set the field's value to something other than one of the values in the list (or to the empty string) will result in an exception.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactEvent
member.summary: Represents a single event in the history of a contact.
member.remarks:
Encompass predefines two events:
First Contact, which is automatically generated when the contact is first created
Completed Loan, when a loan associated with this contact (either as a borrower or as a business partner) is completed

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactLoanMatchType
member.summary: A enumeration used for performing queries against the Encompass contacts database that allows filtering the set of contacts retrieved based on closed loans related to each contact.

member.summary: Do not consider related loans when performing the query.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactLoanMatchType.AnyCompleted
member.summary: Specified criteria must match at least one closed loan for each returned contact.

member.summary: Specified criteria must match the last closed loan for each returned contact.

member.summary: Specified criteria must match the most recently originated loan for each returned contact.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.Contacts.Query(EllieMae.Encompass.Query.QueryCriterion,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactLoanMatchType,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactType)
member.summary: Executes a query to select a subset of the business contacts that match the specified citeria.
member.param: The criterion to use to perform the query. This can be a single criterion or a logical combination of objects which implement the IQueryCriterion interface.
The types of related loans that should be considered when performing this query. This parameters allows you to locate all contacts who satisfy certain loan-related criteria.
The type of contacts being queried.
member.returns: The list of Contact objects that matched the specified criteria.
member.remarks: When querying for BorrowerContacts, a non-administrative user will only be able to see those contacts which are assigned to him. An administrative user, however, is able to query against the set of all contacts.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.Contacts.QueryCursor(EllieMae.Encompass.Query.QueryCriterion,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactLoanMatchType,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.SortCriterionList,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactType)
member.summary: Executes a query and returns the result in a for optimal performance.
member.param: The criterion to use to perform the query. This can be a single criterion or a logical combination of objects which implement the IQueryCriterion interface.
The types of related loans that should be considered when performing this query. This parameters allows you to locate all contacts who satisfy certain loan-related criteria.
The sort criteria to be used to sort the contacts. A null value (Nothing in Visual Basic) can be passed to specify that no sort be applied.
The type of contacts being queried.
member.returns: The list of Contact objects that matched the specified criteria.
member.remarks: A cursor represents a server-side resource that consumes memory on the Encompass Server. To release this memory, be sure to call the cursor's Close() method when the cursor is no longer needed.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.Contacts.GetAll(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactType)
member.summary: Returns a list of all BizContact or BorrowerContact objects defined in the Contact Database.
member.param: The type of contacts being retrieved.
member.returns: When the type parameter is Borrower and the currently logged in user is not an administrator, this function returns the list of only those business contacts assigned to that user. In all other cases, this function will return all available contacts of the specified type.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.Contacts.OpenCursor(EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.SortCriterionList,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Contacts.ContactType)
member.summary: Opens a that contains all contacts for the current user.
member.param: The sort criteria to be used to sort the contacts. A null value (Nothing in Visual Basic) can be passed to specify that no sort be applied.
The type of contacts being queried.
member.returns: A cursor containing the Contact objects to which the user has access.
member.remarks: A cursor represents a server-side resource that consumes memory on the Encompass Server. To release this memory, be sure to call the cursor's Close() method when the cursor is no longer needed.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Attachment
member.summary: Represents a document or image attached to the current loan.
member.remarks:
Every is capable of having any number of electronic document attachments associated with in via the eFolder in Encompass. Attachments can be created in a number of ways: scanning documents into Encompass, receipt of a fax via the Encompass Electronic Document Management feature, by conducting an ePASS transaction such as requesting a credit report, direct attachment via the Encompass UI or import through the API.
Once an attachment is added to the loan, it can be associated with a . Once attached to a document, you can retrieve this document using the method.

member.remarks: Throws an exception if the attachment was added as an image attachment but the option to keep the original was not selected.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Lock
member.summary: Locks the loan for exclusive editing. Once locked, you may make changes to the loan and invoke the Commit method to save those changes to the server.
member.remarks: This method obtains an exclusive lock on the loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Lock(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Locks the loan for editing. Once locked, you may make changes to the loan and invoke the Commit method to save those changes to the server.
member.param: Indicates if an exclusive lock is required.

remarks.p: A loan can be locked for either exclusive or shared editing. An exclusive lock will prevent other users from editing the loan, but obtaining an exclusive lock requires that no other user has an exclusive or shared lock on the loan.

A shared lock will allow other users to open and edit the loan as long as they are also using a shared lock. If an exclusive lock is on the loan, you cannot obtain a shared lock and an exception will occur.

If you have previously obtained a shared lock and you need to upgrade it to an exclusive lock, you can invoke the Lock() method a second time, passing true for the parameter. If you have an exclusive lock, you cannot downgrade the lock to a shared lock without unlocking the loan completely (via the method).

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Unlock
member.summary: Unlocks the loan once editing has been finished. Any pending changes should be Committed prior to unlocking the loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetCurrentLock
member.summary: Returns the current on the loan.
member.returns: The lock information for the current loan, or null if no lock is currently held on this loan. If concurrent editing is enabled, you should consider calling instead to retrieve all locks held on the current loan. If multiple locks are held on this loan, this method will return only one of them.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetCurrentLocks
member.summary: Returns all locks currently held on the loan.
member.returns: Returns a containing all locks held on the current loan. If concurrent editing is enabled and the loan is being edited by multiple users, a LockLock object will be returned for each user who has a lock on the loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.ForceLock
member.summary: Removes an existing locks on the current loan and then locks it for the current user.
member.remarks:
If a lock already exists on the loan, this function will remove it before applying a lock for the current user. This action may cause a user editing the document in Encompass to lose their changes as they will not be able to save the loan. Only invoke this function if you know that existing lock is no longer valid.
When you are done with the lock, call the method. It is not necessary to call to remove the lock applied by this method.
This function requires Administrator rights to invoke if a lock already exists on the loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.ForceUnlock
member.summary: Removes any lock currently held on the loan.
member.remarks:
This function may cause a user editing the document in Encompass to lose their changes as they will not be able to save the loan. Only invoke this function if you know that existing lock is no longer valid. To remove a lock on the loan which was created using the method, call instead.
This function requires Administrator rights to invoke.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Export(System.String,System.String,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanExportFormat)
member.summary: Exports the loan information to one of serveral supported formats.
member.param: The target format to which the loan data will be converted.
Your Encompass API Export Key (see Remarks below for more information).
The path to which to export the file. Any existing file will be overwritten.
member.returns: A string containing the formatted loan data.

remarks.p: Exporting loans using the API requires the use of an Encompass API Export Key. This key is the same as the CD Key used to register the Encompass API SDK/Runtime.

If you are a licensed Encompass Partner and your application is being distributed to Encompass Customers, you should use your own CD Key when calling this method, not the CD Key of of the individual customers who use your software. In general, simply hard-coding this key to your Encompass API CD Key is the preferred technique.
For customer doing their own in-house development, simply use your own Encompass API Key for this purpose.

Before Encompass will perform the export, it must first validate your Export Key by communicating with the Encompass Licensing Servers. To do this, your application must be running on a computer which has Internet access and which permits anonymous requests to the host encompass.elliemae.com. If you are running behind a proxy which requires authentication for outbound connections, an exception will need to be made for this host in order to export data with this method.

If you are a licensed Encompass Partner and your application is being distributed to Encompass Customers, you should use your own CD Key when calling this method, not the CD Key of of the individual customers who use your software. In general, simply hard-coding this key to your Encompass API CD Key is the preferred technique.
For customer doing their own in-house development, simply use your own Encompass API Key for this purpose.

Before Encompass will perform the export, it must first validate your Export Key by communicating with the Encompass Licensing Servers. To do this, your application must be running on a computer which has Internet access and which permits anonymous requests to the host encompass.elliemae.com. If you are running behind a proxy which requires authentication for outbound connections, an exception will need to be made for this host in order to export data with this method.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.ExportAsText(System.String,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanExportFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the loan information to one of serveral supported formats.
member.param: Your Encompass API Export Key (see Remarks below for more information).
The target format to which the loan data will be converted.
Indicates whether only the "current" borrower pair should be exported.

remarks.p: Exporting loans using the API requires the use of an Encompass API Export Key. This key is the same as the CD Key used to register the Encompass API SDK/Runtime.

If you are a licensed Encompass Partner and your application is being distributed to Encompass Customers, you should use your own CD Key when calling this method, not the CD Key of of the individual customers who use your software. In general, simply hard-coding this key to your Encompass API CD Key is the preferred technique.
For customer doing their own in-house development, simply use your own Encompass API Key for this purpose.

Before Encompass will perform the export, it must first validate your Export Key by communicating with the Encompass Licensing Servers. To do this, your application must be running on a computer which has Internet access and which permits anonymous requests to the host encompass.elliemae.com. If you are running behind a proxy which requires authentication for outbound connections, an exception will need to be made for this host in order to export data with this method.

Not all export formats support the currentBorPairOnly option. If you pass a value of true but this option is not supported by your selected export format, a NotSupportedException will be raised. Pass a false value to ensure the export will be successful.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Move(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Moves an existing loan to a new loan folder and/or assigns it a new name.
member.param: The to which to move the loan.
The new name for the loan.
member.remarks:
This method allows existing loans to be moved between loan folders or to be renamed within the current loan folder. To move a loan without changing its name, pass the loan's current for the second parameter. To change the loan's name but keep it in the current folder, pass the object corresponding to the loan's current property value.
If a loan with the name provided already exists in the specified loan folder, an exception will be raised. To have a new name assigned automatically, use the method instead.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.MoveToFolder(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanFolder)
member.summary: Moves the loan to the specified loan folder.
member.param: The to which the loan will be moved.
member.remarks:
Calling this method may result in the of the loan changing since a loan's LoanName is unique within its folder. If a loan with the same LoanName already exists in the target folder, a new loan name will be generated automatically and assigned to the loan. You can determine the new loan name by reading the property after calling this method.
To specify the a new loan name for the loan, use the method instead.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetAccessRights
member.summary: Returns the effective access rights the currently logged in user has to the current loan.
member.returns: The rights for the current user.
member.remarks: For information about effective versus assigned access rights, see the method.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetAssignedAccessRights(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User)
member.summary: Returns the access rights the specified user has to the current loan.
member.param: The user for which to query the rights.
member.returns: The rights for the specified user.
member.remarks: This method may only be called by a user with Full rights on the current loan. Additionally, it may only be called on a commited loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetEffectiveAccessRights(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User)
member.summary: Returns the effective rights the specified user has to the current loan.
member.param: The user for which to query the rights.
member.returns: The user effective rights for the specified user.
member.remarks:
A user's effective rights are determined by a combination of their assigned rights, their persona and their position within the organization hierarchy as follows:
An administrator at the top level of the organization hierarchy will always have rights to all loans.
An administrator at any other level of the organization hierarchy will have rights equal to the greatest of their assigned rights and the assigned rights of all users user below them in the hierarchy.
A non-administrative user's effective rights will always be equal to their assigned rights, if any rights are assigned.
A non-administrative user with no assigned rights will have either read or read/write rights to the loan (based on their user profile) if at least one subordinate has read access to the loan.
This method may only be called by a user with Full rights on the current loan. Additionally, it may only be called on a commited loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.GetUsersWithAssignedRights
member.summary: Generates a list of all users who have assigned rights for the loan.
member.returns: A containing all Users that have assigned rights for the loan.
member.remarks: This method may only be called by a user with Full rights on the current loan. Additionally, it may only be called on a commited loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.AssignRights(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanAccessRights)
member.summary: Modifies the assigned rights of a user to the current loan.
member.param: The user for whom the rights will be assigned.
The rights to assign to this user.
member.remarks:
This function replaces the previous rights of the specified user, if any, with the new rights provided. To revoke all rights from the user, use .
Changes made with this method take affect immediately and do not require you to invoke the Commit() method on the loan. Additionally, the loan does not need to be locked to invoke this method.
This method may only be called by a user with Full rights on the current loan. Additionally, it may only be called on a commited loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.ApplyTemplate(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.Template,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies a template to the current loan.
member.param: The to be applied.
Indicates if the data in the template should be appended to the existing data in the loan or overwrite the data in the loan.
member.remarks: If the appendData parameter is true, only non-empty values from the template will be applied to the loan. Thus, if a field is populated in the loan and unpopulated in the template, the field's value will be preserved. If the parameter is false, all fields from the template, including blank fields values, will overwrite the data in the loan.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.SetClosingDocumentFieldOverride(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a flag indicating if the specified field should be overridden with the loan field value when orderino Closing Documents thru the Ellie Mae Docs Service.
member.param: The ID of the field to be overridden.
Indicates the Doc Service setting should be overriden by the loan's data if true, otherwise the Doc Service value will be used.

remarks.p: The Ellie Mae Closing Doc Service provides customer configuration that is applied to all loans that are run thru the system. It is possible to override the values of certain fields on a per-loan basis by setting the value of the loan field and enabling the override flag for the field.

The only fields that are appropriate to be used for this call are those that start with the "Closing" prefix, e.g. "Closing.LndNm". The fields map to settings within the Doc Service that are configured with the customer's data.

Note that if you set the value of a "Closing" field to a non-empty value, you do not need to explicitly set the override for this field. A non-empty value will always be treated as an override when closing docs are generated. Use this method only to override Doc Service field values with a blank value.
Additionally, if this method is called and the ovrrde parameter is false, any value stored in the field will be wiped out.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.IsClosingDocumentFieldOverridden(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if a value from the loan will override the Ellie Mae Doc Service setting for the specified field.
member.param: The Field ID to be checked. This field ID must start with the "Closing" prefix.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.CalculationsEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the calculation engine in Encompass.
member.remarks: By default, calculations within Encompass are always enabled. Setting this property to false will temporarily disable the calculations, which can have unexpected results when setting the values of fields which are used in calcaultions. Only modify this property if you have verified that your code works correctly when it is disabled.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.BusinessRulesEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the business rule validation for the loan.
member.remarks: If this property is false (the default), the business rules defined for loans will not be enforced. When true, all business rules will be evaluated. As a result, exceptions may occur when setting field values, moving the loan between milestones, etc.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.LoanAccessExceptionsEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables exceptions when setting a field would violate a Loan Access Rule.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.LinkedLoan
member.summary: Returns the loan which is linked to the current loan or null if no loan is currently linked.
member.remarks: Linked loans are typically used in a piggy-back loan scenario in which one loan is the primary and the other the secondary. The relative positions of the loans is determined by the lien positions set on the loans themselves.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.MSLock
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Milestone list is locked.
member.remarks: A true value means the Milestone list is locked in manual mode and MilestoneTemplate will not be applied automatically on save. A false value means the Milestone list is not in manual mode and MillstoneTemplate will be applied automatically on save.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.MSDateLock
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Milestone dates are locked.
member.remarks: A true value means future expected milestone dates will not but updated when one is changed. A false value means future expected milestone dates will be upated when one is changed.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.Locked
member.summary: Indicates if the Loan object has been locked for editing by the current session.
member.remarks: This method only indicates if the loan is locked by the current session (i.e. the Lock() method has been invoked successfully). It does not indicate whether or not a lock is held on the loan by another user. For information on what lock, if any, is held on the loan, use the method.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loan.LockedExclusive
member.summary: Indicates if an exclusive lock is held on the loan by the current session.
member.remarks: This method only indicates if the loan is locked by the current session (i.e. the Lock() method has been invoked successfully). It does not indicate whether or not a lock is held on the loan by another user. For information on what lock, if any, is held on the loan, use the method.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanAuditTrail
member.summary: Provides access to Audit Trail data for the current loan.
member.remarks: When a field is added to the Encompass Audit Trail through the Admin Tools/Reporting Database interface, Encompass will store every change to the field along with the identity of the user who made teh change and the date/time of the change. This class provides the methods for retrieving the audit trail history for the loan.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.ILoanAuditTrail
member.summary: Interface for the LoanAuditTrail class.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanAuditTrail.GetHistory(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the full audit trail history for a field.
member.param: The ID of the auditable field.
member.returns: Returns an AuditTrailEntryList object containing the history of the modifications to the specified field.
member.remarks: The specified field must be marked for inclusion in the Audit Trail, otherwise this method will throw an ArgumentException. The list that is returned will be sorted chronologically with the most recent change first.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanAuditTrail.GetHistory(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns the full audit trail history for a field.
member.param: The List of IDs of the auditable fields.
member.returns: Returns an AuditTrailEntryList object containing the history of the modifications to the specified field.
member.remarks: The specified field must be marked for inclusion in the Audit Trail, otherwise this method will throw an ArgumentException. The list that is returned will be sorted chronologically with the most recent change first.

member.returns: Returns the for the most recent change to the specified field.
member.remarks: The specified field must be marked for inclusion in the Audit Trail, otherwise this method will throw an ArgumentException.

member.summary: Adds a new BorrowerPair to the loan.

member.summary: Removes a BorrowerPair from the loan.
member.param: The BorrowerPair to be removed. This pair must belong to the current loan.
member.remarks:
A loan must always have a least one BorrowerPair. Thus, an attempt to remove the sole BorrowerPair will result in an InvalidOperationException.
This method requires that an exclusive lock be held on the loan.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanField.OriginalValue
member.summary: Gets the calculated value of the field when a field is locked.
member.remarks: When a field is locked, calculations will no longer affect the Value of the field. Instead, the calculated value will be placed in the OriginalValue property of the field.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanField.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the field is locked.

remarks.p: Locking a field provides a way of overriding the value obtained through automatic calculation. If this property is set to true, the field will never be overwritten by the Encompass Calculation Engine. Setting this property to false allows the field's value to be overwritten as needed to ensure consistency with its dependent fields.
Locking or unlocking a field requires that you have an exclusive lock on the loan.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanField.ReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates if the current loan field is read-only.
member.remarks: A field may be read-only either because the underlying is read-only or because of a Loan Access Rule. Field Access Rules are not enforced by the API and thus will not factor in to this proeprty's value.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.LoanFolder.Rebuild
member.summary: Rebuilds the contents of the current Loan Folder on the server.
member.remarks:
This method rebuilds the loan database from the information stored in the loan files within this folder. This process occurs synchronously, so this method may take several minutes before it returns if the number of loans in the folder is large.
The logged in user must have administrative privileges to invoke this method.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loans.Query(EllieMae.Encompass.Query.QueryCriterion)
member.summary: Performs a query on the set of all loans to which the current user has access rights.
member.param: The query criterion (or criteria) used to determine the set of loans to be returned.
member.returns: A LoanIdentityList containing the LoanIdentities of the matching loans. If no loans matched the specified criteria, the list is empty.
member.remarks: If the currently logged in user does not have administrative rights, the Query method will only return loans to which the current user or his subordinates (based on the organization chart) have explicitly defined access rights. Because users with the Administrator persona can access all loans, admin users will query against the entire set of loans on the server.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loans.SelectFields(System.String,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList)
member.summary: Selects a set of field values from a specified loan.
member.param: The unique identifier of the loan from which the field data will be drawn.
A list of the field IDs for the desired fields.
member.returns: A StringList containing the requested field values in the same order as was specified in the fieldIds parameter.
member.remarks: This method provides a more bandwidth-efficient manner to retrieve a small subset of the fields of a loan without having to open the entire loan. Note that because there is no facility for indicating from which Borrower Pair the data will be drawn, the "Current" pair will always be used for borrower-specific field values.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Loans.SubmitBatchUpdate(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.BatchUpdate)
member.summary: Submits a batch update to the server for one or more loans.
member.param: The containing the data to be updated.

remarks.p:
Batch updates allow you to quickly update the value of one or more fields in a set of loans. It is significantly faster than opening the individual loans and setting the field values, but it has several potential drawbacks:
No standard or custom calculations will be invoked. Thus, if the batch modifies fields which are used to calculate other loan values, those values will not be updated.
Triggers associated with the fields will not be invoked.
Business rules, such as Field Access and Loan Access rules, are not applied. All field values will be updated without regard to the rules in place.
Any locks held on the loan are ignored. The changes made by the batch updated will supercede any changes made by users who have the loan currently locked.
Because this method can be used to bypass rules, it can only be invoked by a user with Administrator access to the system.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.Disclosure.EnabledForCompliance
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating disclosure is invalid.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.Disclosure.ReceivedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the disclosure was received by the borrower.
member.remarks: If the disclosure has not been received, this property will be null; otherwise, it will be a DateTime value. To mark a disclosure as not having been received, set this property to null. When the for the disclosure is set to Mail, Fax, or InPerson, the ReceivedDate will be set automatically based on compliance regulations. For Mail deliveries, the ReceivedDate is always three postal days from the date sent. For Fax and InPerson, the date received will match the disclosure date. Attempting to set this property when the DeliveryMethod is any of those values will result in an exception.

member.summary: Represents a transaction from within the Electronic Document Management (EDM) features of Encompass.
member.remarks: An EDM transaction is made to either send a document to the borrower for review or to request that a borrower submit a document for the loan package. Each transaction can consist of multiple document requests, which are presented in the collection. The on the EDMTransaction represents the date on which the request was made of the borrower.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LoanLog
member.summary: Provides access to all of the objects associated with the current loan.

remarks.p: The LoanLog is used to access all of the historical information (both past and future) for a loan as well as information regarding milestones, conditions, tasks, etc., each of which is represented by its own class in the Logging namespace. For each such class, the LoanLog exposes a property which allows access to the collection of records for that event type. For example, the class represents a single milestone in the lifetime of the loan, and the collection of all MilestoneEvents can be accessed through the LoanLog's property.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest
member.summary: Represents a rate lock request for the secondary marketing tool.
member.remarks: When a lock request is made, Encompass creates a snapshot of the lock-related fields which become fixed for that lock. You can access that snapshot's values through the collection, which represents a read-only set of loan fields. Only fields included in the lock request are included.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.ILockRequest
member.summary: Interface for EDMTransaction class.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.IsActive
member.summary: Determines if this request represents an active request or lock.
member.returns: Returns true is the is Pending or RateLocked, false otherwise.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Lock
member.summary: Marks the currently pending lock request as locked, but does not create a confirmation.
member.remarks: Any pending changes made to the collection will be committed when this method is called. Additionally, any calculated fields within the rate lock request will be updated.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Confirm
member.summary: Confirms the lock request.
member.returns: Returns the record for the request.
member.remarks: This method is equivalent to calling and passing the currently logged in User as the confirmingUser.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Confirm(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User)
member.summary: Confirms the lock request.
member.param: The who will be recorded as confirming the lock request. Pass null to indicate the currently logged in user.
member.returns: Returns the record for the request.

remarks.p: Confirming a rate lock causes the buy-side information from the LockRequest to be copied into the loan's primary set of fields. For example, the note rate (field 3) is updated with the Net Buy Rate (2160) from the lock's collection.
The the request has not already been locked, calling the Confirm method will also cause the method to be invoked.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Deny
member.summary: Denies the lock request.
member.returns: Returns the record for the request.
member.remarks: This method is equalivant to calling the method and passing the currently logged in user as the denyingUser.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Deny(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User)
member.summary: Denies the lock request.
member.param: The who is denying the request. A null value can be passed to indicate the currently logged in user.
member.returns: Returns the record for the request.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Extend(System.Int32,System.Decimal,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a lock extension request
member.param: The number of days by which the lock is to be extended.
The price adjustment, if any, incurred by the extension.
Any comments associated with the lock request extension.
member.returns: Returns a new LockRequest object representing the extension request.

remarks.p: A Lock request can only be extended if is is active and has been confirmed. Attempting to extend an lock which does not meet these requirements will result in an exception.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequest.Extend(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Users.User,System.Int32,System.Decimal,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a lock extension request
member.param: The user acting as the requestor of the extension.
The number of days by which the lock is to be extended.
The price adjustment, if any, incurred by the extension.
Any comments associated with the lock request extension.
member.returns: Returns a LockRequest object representing the extension request.

remarks.p: A Lock request can only be extended if is is active and has been confirmed. Attempting to extend an lock which does not meet these requirements will result in an exception.
If the priceAdjutsment parameter is set to zero and the system policy indicates that the price adjustment is calculated automatically, the adjustment will be calculated.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequestFields.Recalculate
member.summary: Forces a recalculation of the calculated lock request fields.
member.remarks: The lock request fields do not automatically recalculate when a field's value is changed. Typically, the calculated field values are updated when you call , but there may be cases when you need to see the results of the calculations prior to calling that method. You can use this method to force a recalculation of the fields within the lock request at any time.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LockRequestFields.CommitChanges
member.summary: Commits the changes made to the lock request snapshot field collection.
member.remarks: When this collection of fields is modified, the changes are not saved unless you call CommitChanges, which pushes the modifications into the loan file. This method should be invoked before calling the method to save the loan to the server.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.LogMilestoneEvents.GetEventForMilestone(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a MilestoneEvent from the collection based on the name of the corresponding Milestone object.
member.param: The name of the milestone. This value is case insenstitive but must not be null or the empty string.
member.returns: Returns the event for the specified milestone, if defined; null otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method should always return a non-null value when the milestoneName is that of a "core" milestone, such as Started or Completion. However, for custom milestones, this method will return null if the current loan does not have an event defined for the specified milestone.
For a list of the names of the pre-defined Milestones which are part of every loan's lifetime sequence, see the Remarks section for the object.

member.param: The MilestoneID of the Milestone. This can be a number value or a GUID value.
member.returns: Returns the MilestoneEvent for the specified milestone, if defined; null otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method should always return a non-null value when the milestoneID is that of a "core" milestone, such as Started or Completion. However, for custom milestones, this method will return null if the current loan does not have an event defined for the specified milestone.
For a list of the names of the pre-defined Milestones which are part of every loan's lifetime sequence, see the Remarks section for the object.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent
member.summary: Represents a single milestone-related event in the lifetime of a Loan.
member.remarks:
Inspecting a loan's MilestoneEvents is useful for determining which stages of the loan lifetime sequence have already been completed and which remain to be done. The Date of a MilestoneEvent represents the point in time at which the associated has either been achieved (if the flag is true) or is scheduled to be achieved (if is false).
Some MilestoneEvents' Date may be set to null, which indicates that the loan has not progressed far enough for an estimated completion date to be available for the associated Milestone. In particular, until the the first milestone (other than File Started) is crossed, no milestones that occur afterward are assigned scheduled completion dates. Once a milestone is completed, all subsequent milestones' expected completion dates will be populated.
As with all LogEntries, MilestoneEvent instances become invalid when the Refresh method is invoked on the parent Loan object. Attempting to access this object after invoking refresh will result in an exception.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.IMilestoneEvent
member.summary: Interface for MilestoneEvent class.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.EllieMae#Encompass#BusinessObjects#Loans#Logging#IMilestoneEvent#SetDate(System.Object)
member.summary: Provides a COM-accessible method for setting the date on a Milestone event.
member.param: The date for the milestone event.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.AdjustDate(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adjusts the date of a milestone event and, if desired, the previous and successive milestones events.
member.param: The new completion or expected completion date for the milestone event.

Passing the value true allows the expected completion dates for past milestones to be adjusted based on the newly specified date for the current milestone. In particular, a true value will have the following effects:
Any incomplete milestone events which precede the current milestone in the lifetime sequence and which are scheduled to be completed after newDate will be modified to be due on newDate.
Any unscheduled milestone events which precede the current milestone will be scheduled to be completed on newDate.
If this parameter is false, the scheduled completion times of milestone events earlier in the sequence will never be modified. As a result, if an attempt is made to schedule this milestone prior to the scheduled date of a prior milestone, or if an attempt is made to schedule a milestone while preceded by an unscheduled milestone, this method will raise an exception.

If true and the next milestone event is not marked as completed, then any incomplete, scheduled, future milestone events will have their expected completion dates adjusted based on the difference between the current milestone event's prior completion date and the value specified by newDate. For example, if you modify the date of the Submittal milestone event by adding 2 days to it and the next milestone event (Approval) has not yet been completed, then the Approval milestone and all subsequent milestones will have two days added to their scheduled completion dates. If this parameter is false, the dates of subsequent milestones are not adjusted and the date specified by newDate may not fall after the date of any subsequent milestone.
member.remarks: This method allows the schedule for milestone events to be changed either into the past or the future. However, the date of a milestone can never be adjusted so that it precedes the date of any previously completed milestone or comes after the date of any subsequently completed milestone.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.EntryType
member.summary: Gets the for the current entry.
member.remarks: This property will always return the value .

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.MilestoneID
member.summary: Gets the MilestoneID of the Milestone related to the MilestoneEvent.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.MilestoneName
member.summary: Gets the name of the milestone with which this entry is associated.
member.remarks:
You may use this value to attempt to locate the corresponding Milestone object associated with this event. However, because the lifetime sequence of the current loan was determine when the loan was created, this name may not be a currently defined milestone in the Encompass system's default milestone sequence.
For a list of the pre-defined Milestones which are part of every loan's lifetime sequence, see the Remarks section for the object.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.Completed
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if this milestone has been reached.
member.remarks:
Setting this property to true will indicate that this milestone has been completed and will advance the loan to the next stage in the lifetime sequence. Because a complete milestone must have a date associated with it, setting this property to true will automatically cause the property to be set to the current date if previously null.
Additionally, if this property is set to true and the current milestone is not the next milestone scheduled to be completed, all prior, incomplete miletones are marked as completed and their completion dates are updated to match the date of this milestone event.
If this property is set to false and one or more completed milestones follow this event, those milestones are set to incomplete and what were previously their completion dates become their new scheduled completion dates.
Note that an exception will be raised if you attempt to modify this property for the Started milestone, for which this property always returns true.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the completion date (or expected completion date) for the current milestone.
member.remarks:
When the property is true, this date represents the date on which the milestone was achieved. If is false, this date represents the projected completion date, if one is available. If no projected date is available, this property returns null.
You may also use this property to modify the completion date or expected completion date of a milestone in a loan. However, the new date must not precede the date of any milestone earlier in the lifetime sequence or come after any milestone later in the lifetime sequence. If you wish to adjust the entire miletone schedule, use the method.
Developers of COM-based clients will need to invoke the SetDate() method in order to modify the date on this object.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.MilestoneEvent.IsAlert
member.summary: Indicates if this MilestoneEvent is in alert status.
member.remarks:
A MilestoneEvent is considered to be an alert if both of the following conditions are met:
The Date is non-null and is on or before today.
The property is false.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument
member.summary: Represents a single Document Tracking entry associated with a Loan.
member.remarks:
The Date property of a TrackedDocument represents either the date on which the document is due to be received or the day the document actually was received.
TrackedDocument instances become invalid when the Refresh method is invoked on the parent Loan object. Attempting to access this object after invoking refresh will result in an exception.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.Ordered
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the document has been ordered.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.OrderDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the document was ordered/requested.
member.remarks: If the document has not been ordered, this property will be null; otherwise, it will be a DateTime value. Modifying the OrderDate for a document will cause the ExpirationDate and DueDate to be adjusted accordingly. Because of a limitation in the way COM marshals date values when exposed as a VARIANT, COM-based clients should call the SetOrderDate() method to set this property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.OrderedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user who ordered/requested this document.
member.remarks: The property must be set prior to setting this property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.Reordered
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the document has been re-ordered.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.ReorderDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the document was re-ordered.
member.remarks: If the document has not been re-ordered, this property will be null; otherwise, it will be a DateTime value. To mark a document as having been re-ordered, set this property to the approrpiate date. Once reordered, the DueDate and ExpirationDate will be reset accordingly. Because of a limitation in the way COM marshals date values when exposed as a VARIANT, COM-based clients should call the SetReorderDate() method to set this property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.ReorderedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user who ordered/requested this document.
member.remarks: The property must be set prior to setting this property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days from the order date until the document is due.
member.remarks: Modifying this property will cause the DueDate to be reset based on the number of days entered.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.Due
member.summary: Indicates if the document is currently in the Due/Expected state.
member.remarks: A document is due if it has a valid .

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.DueDate
member.summary: Gets the date on which the document is due.
member.remarks: This property will return null until a valid OrderDate is set for the document. Once the OrderDate is set, this property is calculated by adding to it the value of the DueDays property.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Logging.TrackedDocument.PastDue
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating if this document is past due.
member.remarks: If the property is null, this property will always return false. Otherwise, it will return true if the is prior to the current date and the is null.

A TrackedDocument is considered to be an alert if either of the following conditions are met:
The is null and the is on or prior to today.
The is on or prior to today.
Note that these conditions differ slightly from the and properties, which will not return true until the respective dates are in the past.

member.summary: An alert indicating that a milestone has been completed.

member.summary: An follow-up alert related to a perviously held conversation

member.summary: An alert related to the expected arrival or expiration of a document

member.summary: Indicates that a servicing distribution from escrow is due.

member.summary: An reminder alert related to a milestone task entry

member.summary: An alert caused by the expiration (or pending expiration) of a milestone

member.summary: An alert related to the pending expiration of a rate lock

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.PipelineData.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the data for a specified summary field.
member.remarks:
The set of summary field available to the user correponds to fields which can be used to query for a loan. However, when specifying the field name, the leading portion of the canonical name should be omitted.
For example, the canonical name for the field containing the borrower's last name is "Loan.BorrowerLastName". To access the last name in the PipelineData class, simply use the field name "BorrowerLastName".

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Servicing.LoanServicing.Start
member.summary: Starts the servicing process for the loan.

remarks.p: The Start method must be called once on the loan prior to processing transactions to enable the servicing features. If Start is called a second time, it will be ignored.
This method is supported in Banker Edition only.
