member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Servicing.Payment.TransactionAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total payment received.
member.remarks:
This property represents the sum of the , , , , , , and values, which determine how the payment is to allocated.
If you set this property directly and its value is greater than the sum of the , , , , and values, the amount will be adjusted to ensure that the above properties sum to the specified total transaction amount.
If you set this property directly and its value is less than the sum of the , , , , and values, the amount will be set to 0 and the Principal amount paid will be reduced by the difference in the amounts to ensure the transaction total is accurate.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.Templates.GetTemplate(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateType,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a loan template from the Encompass Server.
member.param: The type of template to be retrieved.
The path of the template.
member.returns: Returns the specified template or null if no template with the specified path is found.

remarks.p:
Every template in Encompass has a well-defined that can be used to retrieve the template from the Encompass Server. The path is made up or three parts:
Domain, which can be either "public" or "personal" and identifies the template as being a publicly-accessible template available to all users or a private template available on to it owner.
Folders, which is the delimited folder hierarchy in which the template resides. The elements of the path are separated using the backslash (\) character.
Name, which is the name of the template and can include any printable character except the path delimiter (\).
A full path for a template would then have the format: <domain>:\<folder>\<name> For example, a publicly-accessible template named "MyTemplate" which resides in the folders "LenderA\ARMs" would be "public:\LenderA\ARMs\MyTemplate".

If a personal template path is specified, the template's owner is assumed to be the currently logged in user. Thus, you should not pass in a user-qualified path for this parameter. To retrieve a personal template for a user other than the currently logged in user, use the overload of GetTemplate that allows a to be specified.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.Templates.GetTemplate(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateType,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry)
member.summary: Retrieves a Template from the server.
member.param: The type of template to be retrieved.
The of the template to be retrieved.
member.returns: Returns the specified template, if found, or null if the template is not found.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.Templates.GetTemplateFolderContents(EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateType,EllieMae.Encompass.BusinessObjects.Loans.Templates.TemplateEntry)
member.summary: Gets the contents of a folder in the template repository.
member.param: The type of template for which the directory contents are to be retrieved.
The that represents the folder for which the request is being made.
member.returns: Returns a containing the entries within the specified folder. Each entry represents either a subfolder of the specified folderEntry or a template that resides in the folder. The method does not recurse into subfolders of the specified folder, thus if you wish to retrieve all templates you will need to call this method recursively. Such recursive calls may perform poorly on systems with large numbers of templates.

This method may only be called by users with the Administrator persona. Additionally, it may only be called on Users which have already been committed to the Encompass Server.
The change of organization occurrs immediately upon calling this method. It is not necessary to invoke to make this change permanent.

member.remarks:
This method can only be invoked by an Administrator. Additionally, a free license must be available for this user or an exception will be raised.
If invoked on an existing user (one for which return false, the change will occur immediately without a need to call the method.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.DataExchange.DataReceived
member.summary: An event used for data exchange between Encompass clients.
member.remarks: The DataReceived event can be used to take advantage of Encompass's internal messaging system to send custom data between Encompass sessions. A message is sent using one of the methods , or . If you have subscribed to this event, you can then receive this message and interpret the contents in whatever way makes sense to you. The Encompass application does not use this event so it is made available solely for use by custom application developers who need to transmit data between clients.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.LoginException
member.summary: Exception indicating a failed login to an Encompass Server or offline system.
member.remarks:
A login failure may occur if an invalid user ID or password is used, the user's account has been disabled, the server's license limit has been exceeded, etc. The exception's Message property will indicate the exact cause of the error.
COM-based application can identify this exception using the HRESULT value 0x80042104.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents
member.summary: Provides access to global server events.
member.remarks:
Using the ServerEvents class it is possible to monitor server-wide events such as logins, license management and loan actions (e.g. users opening or closing a loan). To receive these events your code must subscribe to one or more of the event handlers provided by this class. Each event handler is meant to provide information on different types of activities on the server.
Note that if your company uses multiple Encompass Servers, only the events that occur on the server to which the connection is made will be received. To receive events for all of your Encompass servers you must establish a with each server and subscribe to its events.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.IServerEvents
member.summary: Interface for Session class.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents.ConnectionMonitor
member.summary: Provides notification of low-level connection events on the Encompass Server.
member.remarks: A connection events is fired whenever a new TCP/IP connections is initiated from a remote client machine. Additionally, an evet is fired when the connection is closed, although the event will often trail the actual closing of the connection by several minutes as the server is setup to allow a client to reconnect in the event of a low-level connection failure.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents.ExceptionMonitor
member.summary: Provides notification of error and other exception-type events on the Encompass Server.
member.remarks: Most exception events will occur only when an unhandled exception occurs within the Encompass Server. However, you can also use this handler to catch events so you can monitor failed logins to your Encompass server.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents.LicenseMonitor
member.summary: Provides notification of licensing-related events on the Encompass Server.
member.remarks: When a client connection is made the Encompass Server attempts to allocate a license to it from the license pool. These event indicate the success or failure of that process as well as notifying you when a license is released back to the pool. You can use these event to track your license usage over time.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents.LoanMonitor
member.summary: Provides notification of loan-related events on the Encompass Server.
member.remarks:
Use the loan monitor events to track when loans are opened, saved, closed, imported, etc. Whenever such an action occurs, the server raises an event which can be captured and acted upon. The event information includes both information on the user who performed the event as well as the loan on which the action was taken.
Using the LoanMonitor event, it is possible to set up real-time synchronization with an external data system. The example below demonstrates how this can be done.

member.name: E:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.ServerEvents.SessionMonitor
member.summary: Provides notification of session-related events on the Encompass Server.
member.remarks: Session monitoring allows you to monitor user activity in the Encompass Server. Whenever a user logs in or out (or their session is otherwise terminated), a session event occurs.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.Session
member.summary: Represents a single client connection to an Encompass Server or to an Offline Encompass database.
member.remarks:
The Session object represents the entry point for an Encompass client session. The client application uses this object to establish a login session with the server and then to subsequently access object data from the server.
Session instances, as well as instances of any other class within the EncompassObjects API, are not thread-safe. If you wish to use the objects from multiple threads, you will need to protect the objects to safeguard against concurrent access.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.Session.Start(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a session with a remote Encompass Server.
member.param: The URI of the remote server. This URI should include the protocol to use (tcp or http), the hostname/port number of the remote server and, in the case of an HTTP server, the virtual root at which the server resides.
The Encompass login ID for the current user.
The password for the current user.
member.remarks: When starting a remote session, care should be taken to catch the VersionException if it is thrown. This exception indicates that the Encompass versions on the client and server are incompatible. The client or server will need to be updated with the correct software version in order to log in again.
member.exception: Indicates that the client was unable to establish a connection to the remote Encompass Server.
Indicates that Encompass API on the client (local) computer is incompatible with the version of the Encompass Server.
Indicates that the server was unable to satisfy the login request. This may be due to an invalid user ID or password, the user's account being disabled, etc.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.VersionException
member.summary: Exception that indicates that an attempt was made to connect to an Encompass Server which has an incompatible version number.
member.remarks:
Encompass requires that the client and server be running the same software version in order to ensure compatibility. If an attempt is made to connect to a server which is running a different version of Encompass (whether newer or older), this exception will be raised and the session will not be started.
This exception can be identified in COM-based applications using the HRESULT value 0x80042202.

member.summary: Gets the Encompass software version of the local (client) machine.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.Client.VersionException.ServerVersion
member.summary: Gets the Encompass software version running on the remote server.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Licensing.LicenseManager
member.summary: Provides methods for managing the Encompass SDK license. This class is meant for use primarilly within the Encompass SDK Licensing Tools; however, developers may use this class to provide increased control over client licensing.

member.summary: Interface for LicenseManager class.

member.summary: Constructs a new LicenseManager object.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Licensing.LicenseManager.GetEncompassVersion(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the current version of Encompass.
member.param: Indicates if the version number should include the hotfix revision number as the fourth digit of the version.
member.returns: If the includeHotfixLevel parameter is true, it returns the version of Encompass as a string in the format <MajorVersion>.<MinorVersion>.<Revision>.<HotfixLevel>, e.g. "6.0.1.3". If the includeHotfixLevel is false, then the HotfixLevel value will be omitted from the version number, e.g. "6.0.1".
member.remarks: An Encompass client and Encompass server are considered to be compatible if and only if their major, minor and revision values are the same. The hotfix level does not play into the compatibility between client and server.

member.summary: Generates a license for the current machine based on the supplied License Key.
member.param: The license key with which to register the SDK.
member.remarks: A current connection to the Internet must exist in order to license the Encompass API. If the method returns without throwing an exception, then a license has been successfully installed on the current computer.

member.summary: Attempts to refresh the existing license for the current version of the Encompass software.

member.summary: Indicates if the current machine has a previously registered license key.
member.returns: A flag indicating if a license key exists on this machine.
member.remarks: A return value of true does not indicate if the license key is valid or that the SDK will function. It simply indicates that a license key is present on this machine.

member.summary: Validates the current machine's license.
member.param: Indicates is the License Manager should attempt to refresh the current license, by invoking RefreshLicense(), if the computer's current license is determined to be invalid but a previously- registered license key is found.

member.summary: An exact match (including case) is required.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.StringFieldMatchType.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: An exact match (excluding case) is required.

member.summary: The field value must start with the specified substring (case insensitive).

member.summary: The field value must contain the specified substring (case insensitive).

member.summary: Identifies the desired ordinal relationship between a numeric or date criterion and the field values against which the criterion applies.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.Equals
member.summary: An exact match is required.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.NotEquals
member.summary: The field value must not match the specified criterion value.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.GreaterThan
member.summary: The field value must be greater than the specified criterion value.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.GreaterThanOrEquals
member.summary: The field value must be greater than or equal to the specified criterion value.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.LessThan
member.summary: The field value must be less than the specified criterion value.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.OrdinalFieldMatchType.LessThanOrEquals
member.summary: The field value must be less than or equal to the specified criterion value.

member.name: T:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision
member.summary: Identifies the precision with which a DateTime value must match the value of the field to which the criterion applies.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision.Exact
member.summary: Date and time must match exactly.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision.Day
member.summary: Only the date portion must match exactly (i.e. time is ignored).

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision.Month
member.summary: Only the month and year must match.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision.Year
member.summary: Only the year must match.

member.name: F:EllieMae.Encompass.Query.DateFieldMatchPrecision.Recurring
member.summary: Only the day and month must match. This is useful for querying fields that represent recurring dates such as birthdays or anniversaries.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Reporting.Reports.OpenReportCursor(EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList,EllieMae.Encompass.Query.QueryCriterion,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.SortCriterionList)
member.summary: Executes a query against the list of loans an opens a report cursor with the results.
member.param: A containing the list of canonical field names to be retrieved from the server.
A defining the filter, if any, to be applied to the query.
An option specifying the order in which the results should be returned.
member.returns: Returns a containing the results for the specified query.

remarks.p: This method provides a very efficient means of retrieving a fixed set of field values from an user-defined set of loans. The list of fields specified in the fieldsToRetrieve parameter must use the Canonical Field Name format defined in the SDK Programmer's Guide. As a result, you can only retrieve field values which are represented by one of the pre-defined canonical field names or which you have added into the Reporting Database feature of Encompass.
For more information on the use of this method, see the "Advanced Reporting" section of the Encompass SDK Programmer's Guide.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Reporting.Reports.OpenReportCursor(System.Boolean,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList,EllieMae.Encompass.Query.QueryCriterion,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.SortCriterionList)
member.summary: Executes a query against the list of loans an opens a report cursor with the results.
member.param: A boolean flag indicating if the data should be pulled from the External Reporting Database (ERDB).
A containing the list of canonical field names to be retrieved from the server.
A defining the filter, if any, to be applied to the query.
An option specifying the order in which the results should be returned.
member.returns: Returns a containing the results for the specified query.

remarks.p: This method provides a very efficient means of retrieving a fixed set of field values from an user-defined set of loans. The list of fields specified in the fieldsToRetrieve parameter must use the Canonical Field Name format defined in the SDK Programmer's Guide. As a result, you can only retrieve field values which are represented by one of the pre-defined canonical field names or which you have added into the Reporting Database feature of Encompass.
For more information on the use of this method, see the "Advanced Reporting" section of the Encompass SDK Programmer's Guide.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Reporting.Reports.SelectReportingFieldsForLoans(EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList)
member.summary: Retrieves the values of a specific set of fields for one or more loans.
member.param: The list of GUIDs for the selected set of loans.
The list of canonical fields names to be retrieved from the server.
member.returns: Returns a containing the field values for the specified loans.

remarks.p: The order of the result set matches the order of the loan GUIDs specified in the loanGuids parameter.

The list of fields specified in the fieldsToRetrieve parameter must use the Canonical Field Name format defined in the SDK Programmer's Guide. As a result, you can only retrieve field values which are represented by one of the pre-defined canonical field names or which you have added into the Reporting Database feature of Encompass.

Note that if the number of GUIDs passed to this function becomes large, then it will become increasingly inefficient. Instead, use the method for a more efficient means to selecting field values for a large set of loans.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Reporting.Reports.SelectReportingFieldsForLoan(System.String,EllieMae.Encompass.Collections.StringList)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of field values for a single loan.
member.param: The GUID of the specified loan.
The list of canonical field names to be retrieved.
member.returns: Returns a object containing the field values specified or null if no such loan exists.

member.name: M:EllieMae.Encompass.Versioning.VersionManager.GetVersionUpgradeURL(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the URL of an SDK software update for the specified target version.
member.param: The Encompass version to which the system is to be upgraded.
member.returns: The URL of the installation package for the specified target version, if one exists. An empty return value indicates that no update exists for the specified version or the update is not version compatible with the currently installed version. An exception is thrown if the current computer's license does not permit upgrades.

member.name: P:EllieMae.Encompass.Versioning.VersionManager.CurrentVersion
member.summary: Gets the current version of the SDK installed on the computer.
